Komodo | Indonesia

16 March 2017 | By James Whittock

Komodo National Park is located about 1hrs flight east of Bali. It has been selected as one of theÂ new 7 wonders of nature. The waters surrounding Komodo island also contains rich marine biodiversity. Komodo islands is also a part of the coral triangle, which contains some of the richest marine biodiversity on Earth. It is also home to the famous Komodo dragon which you can visit on a short trip to one of the islands. As it is a national park it has been very well protected by the Indonesian government so the wildlife both above and below the sea is in abundance compared to most other parts of the world.
